intro: Peucedanum petroselinum, commonly known as parsley, is a biennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant has finely divided, feather-like leaves that are widely used as a culinary herb. Its seeds, known as anise, are also valued for their distinctive flavor and medicinal properties. Peucedanum petroselinum thrives in cool climates and well-drained soil, making it a popular garden plant.
